]]'The Progress Energy Center for the Performing Arts' is the main venue for the
performing arts in Raleigh, North Carolina.

The naming rights to the center currently are held by Progress Energy, which
purchased them from the city in 2005 for a 20-year term at the cost of $7.5
million. The original naming rights previously were held by BTI Telecom
(acquired by ITC^DeltaCom in 2003), and the facility was known as the BTI Center
for the Performing Arts from 1997-2005.

The center consists of:
* Raleigh Memorial Auditorium (opened 1932, renovated 1990)
* Meymandi Concert Hall (opened 2001)
* A. J. Fletcher Opera Theater (opened 2001)
* Kennedy Theater (opened 2001)
* Lichtin Plaza (opened 2001)
